CatDescriptText: Miss Lula Brundage, laundry worker, Third Ward and Mr. Joseph Murphy, city employee, Fifth Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "In your opinion, what do you think is the most effective protest medium Negro people have today?" Miss Lula Brundage's answer reads: "I really don't know, but the picketing has helped a great deal.  I don't think the freedom riders are the most effective way."  Mr. Joseph Murphy's answer reads: "I would say voting."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Lula Brundage wearing light colored jacket with knitted sleeves and collar, holding Simco shoe box and newspaper with headline reading "Philco Files Suit, Charges Plan Stolen", posed in front of building; Portrait of Joseph Murphy wearing fedora with dark band, and light colored zippered jacket, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
